business.headline: Markets open higher on easing inflation; mixed global cues keep investors cautiousThe S&P BSE Sensex initially rose over 300 points but pared some gains to trade 155.05 points higher at 80,390.64 around 9:25 am. The NSE Nifty50 was up 71.60 points to 24,559.

Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore fortune without will: Who's likely to gain most?In the weeks since Sunjay Kapur's death, the silence around succession has been broken by a chorus of competing voices: his mother Rani Kapur, his widow Priya Sachdev Kapur, his sisters, and even mentions of his former wives.
Nikkei's share average hits record-high, tops 43,000 for first timeThe Nikkei .N225 on Wednesday rose as much as 1.2 per cent in the first few minutes of trade to reach a record 43,241.27.

Lapses, irregularities, round tipping: Yes Bank's Rs 500 crore loan sale under scannerThe audit found indications that YES Bank may have indirectly financed the purchase of its own stressed asset. The transaction dates back to March 31, 2017, when the bank sold HDIL's non-performing loan, valued at over Rs 523 crore including interest, to Suraksha ARC for Rs 518 crore.

Ambanis retain crown as India's most valuable family business in 2025Mukesh Ambani leads Reliance Industries Limited, which has roots in the energy sector but also has major operations in retail and digital services. Founded in 1957 by Dhirubhai Ambani, the company is now managed by the second generation and continues to be a key force in India's economy.

Sebi rejects Anil Ambani's plea in Yes Bank case, ED probe continues: ReportThe case relates to investments worth Rs 21,500 crore made by Reliance Mutual Fund, then owned by Anil Ambani, in Yes Bank's additional tier-1 (AT-1) bonds between 2016 and 2019.

Retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in JulyRetail inflation declined to an 8-year low in July 2025 as food prices plunged sharply. Both rural and urban areas experienced deflation in food prices, with rural food inflation at -1.74% and urban at -1.90%.
Sensex ends 368 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; Maruti down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 368.49 points to end at 80,235.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 97.65 points to close at 24,487.40.
RBI's job gets tougher, thanks to 50% US tariffsRBI kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% and warned that US tariffs and global supply issues could quickly change the outlook.

SIPs for the win: How Trump tariffs shook D-Street but boosted mutual fundsMutual funds are seeing record inflows even as markets struggle. Are SIP investors spotting an opportunity the rest are missing, or is it just faith in long-term discipline?
India bans land imports of more Bangladesh jute productsEarlier on June 27, India prohibited imports of a number of jute products and woven fabrics from Bangladesh through all land routes.

5 SIP myths that hurt investors more than markets, explains stock market expertMany investors blame market volatility for poor returns, but often, it's the myths they believe about SIPs that do more harm. Here's what an expert reveals.

entertainment.headline: You made my life colourful: Parag Tyagi's note for Shefali on wedding anniversaryOn Tuesday, actor Parag Tyagi marked his 11th wedding anniversary with Shefali Jariwala by sharing a heartfelt note on Instagram. The couple's journey began in 2010 when they first met.

Coolie vs War 2 advance booking: Expert says clear win for Rajinikanth's filmAhead of its release, 'Coolie' is leading against Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' in advance sales. Trade expert Ramesh Bala noted that the Rajinikanth-starrer is estimated to have crossed Rs 80 crore in advance sales.

Did Aamir Khan charge Rs 20 crore for Rajinikanth's Coolie? Here's the truthAs opposed to the viral reports, actor Aamir Khan is not charging anything for his brief role in 'Coolie'. The actor is playing a negative role in the Lokesh Kanagaraj directorial.

From art to mass appeal: Are the National Awards losing relevance? Experts answerNational Awards are facing criticism for favouring commercial blockbusters over indie films. Experts question if the awards still hold their original relevance in today's social media age.

The Nice Guy review: Lee Dong-wook's drama is slow, sweet, and strikingly relevantRelease Date:Fri Jul 18, 2025The Nice Guy Kdrama review: The Lee Dong-wook starrer offers a slow, heartfelt take on the gangster drama genre. It highlights the struggles of family duty and dreams amid harsh realities.

Jennifer Aniston says media coverage of her divorce with Brad Pitt was shamefulActor Jennifer Aniston recently recalled how she was affected by the media scrutiny during her divorce from actor Brad Pitt. She also reflected on how celebrities struggle for privacy when it comes to their personal lives.

Saiyaara OTT release: When and where to watch Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda filmSaiyaara, which is currently running in theatres, will premiere on OTT in a month's time. The Mohir Suri directorial, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, released in theatres on July 18.

39 years after Baghwaan Dada, Hrithik and Rajinikanth to clash at box officeWith Hrithik Roshan's 'War 2' and Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' clashing at the box office, fans recalled the time when Roshan shared screen space with the veteran actor in 'Bhagwaan Dada (1986).

Kartik Aaryan to play Air Force pilot in Shimit Amin's film Captain India: ReportActor Kartik Aaryan is reportedly set to collaborate with 'Chak De India' director Shimit Amin. He will play the role of an Air Force pilot in the film titled 'Captain India'. Filming will begin in 2026 with locations in India and Morocco.

Channing Tatum joins Demon Slayer Infinity Castle English voice cast Hollywood actor Channing Tatum and voice actor Rebecca Wang join the English dub cast of 'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Movie: Infinity Castle', the next chapter in the record-breaking anime saga. The film premieres in Japan in July 2025.

When Kamal Haasan said no to Main Hoon Na with a polite 'duck off' to Farah KhanFilmmaker Farah Khan shared that Kamal Haasan refused a role in her debut film 'Main Hoon Na'. She recalled travelling to Chennai to narrate the script. The role eventually went to actor Suniel Shetty.

A Gen-Z review of Sholay: 50 years later, still a total vibeRevisiting Bollywood classic Sholay through a Gen-Z lens: Basanti's feminist flair, Jai-Veeru's ultimate friendship goals, Gabbar's meme-worthy villainy, and Thakur's poetic revenge.

general news.headline: PM Modi likely to meet Trump next month in US as trade tensions simmerDuring PM Modi's likely visit to New York, plans are afoot to schedule a meeting with US President Donald Trump to iron out issues on trade amid a downturn in ties.

Congress cites '50 sons of 1 man' to claim Varanasi voter fraud. What's the truth?The controversy began after the UP Congress posted on social media a voter list from the Kashmiriganj area of Varanasi's Ward No. 51, claiming that over 50 people were registered as "sons" of a single man, Ramkamal Das.

CCTV shows disabled UP woman chased on deserted road, cops say she was rapedA 21-year-old specially-abled woman was allegedly raped in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur, police said. The survivor was caught on camera running for her life on a deserted road, with bike-borne men chasing her.

A promo of the episode has sparked a controversy. Here is why.

A question Congress needs to answer on sacked Karnataka ministerThe Congress is seeking answers from the Election Commission over electoral rolls. However, it has fired a Karnataka minister for asking pertinent questions on the same issue. What were the troubling questions that made the Congress remove a minister? Will Congress answer the one big question?

Shameful is your deceit: Israeli envoy jabs Priyanka Gandhi over genocide claimA war of words broke out between Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Israeli ambassador to India Reuven Azar after the Congress MP accused the Jewish nation of committing genocide in Gaza. The envoy sharply rejected her claims, calling them shameful.

10, including 7 children, killed in pickup van-truck collision in RajasthanEleven, including seven children, were killed in a road accident in Rajasthan's Dausa after a pickup van collided with a truck.

Erwin Schrodinger, the man behind the famous cat experiment that questioned realityIn 1935, in a Europe on the brink of war, Erwin Schrodinger trapped an imaginary cat inside a quantum puzzle -- and in doing so, forced the world to question what "real" even means. Here's more about the life of the brilliant physicist who bagged the Nobel prize for wave mechanics, lit the spark behind the DNA double helix discovery, and of course, gave us the famous cat.

Fresh off World Cup success, Divya Deshmukh continues giant-slaying runFresh from her historic Women's World Cup triumph, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh underlined her status as India's brightest chess prospect with a commanding 10–3 demolition of China's world No. 7 Lei Tingjie at the 2025 Women's Speed Chess Championship, adding another top-ranked scalp to her growing list.

Hope 120, Pakistan 92-all out: Fans fume over 1st ODI series loss in 34 yearsPakistan fans lost their cool at the cricket team after Mohammed Rizwan's side were bowled out for just 92 runs in the series-decider against West Indies. This is the first time that Pakistan have lost an ODI bilateral to West Indies since 1991/92.

West Indies cricket battles funding crisis as glory days fade into distant memoryWest Indies cricket, once a dominant global force, now faces a deep crisis driven by years of mismanagement, financial instability, and player exodus to lucrative T20 leagues. The decline stems from systemic governance failures, crumbling infrastructure, and a loss of national pride, turning a proud legacy into a cautionary tale.

Shai Hope closes in on Brian Lara with 18th ODI centuryWI vs PAK: Shai Hope scored his 18th ODI century with an unbeaten 120 against Pakistan, surpassing Desmond Haynes and closing in on Brian Lara's record of 19 centuries, helping West Indies post 294 for six in the series decider.

Supreme Court appoints Justice Rao as Bihar Cricket Association ombudsmanThe Supreme Court on Tuesday appointed its retired judge, L. Nageswara Rao, as the ombudsman of the Bihar Cricket Association to address alleged illegal activities by certain office bearers.

ED summons ex-cricketer Suresh Raina for questioning in illegal betting app caseThis summons comes as part of a wider crackdown on illegal betting apps and platforms, many of which have been promoted by celebrities.

Ex-RCB pacer joins OnlyFans, barred from using logo on bat in The HundredTymal Mills became the first professional cricketer to join OnlyFans, focusing on cricket and lifestyle content. The England cricket board denied his request to display the OnlyFans logo on his bat due to family-friendly concerns.

Ayush Mhatre to lead Sarfaraz Khan-starrer Mumbai in Buchi Babu TournamentYoung opener Ayush Mhatre was on Tuesday named captain of Mumbai's 17-member squad for the Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament, to be held in Chennai later this month.

Roger Binny to continue as BCCI president at least until September: ReportRoger Binny will continue as BCCI president at least until the Annual General Meeting in September. According to the National Sports Bill, 75 is now the cut-off age for office bearers of National Sports Federations.

Former New Zealand batter to play for Scotland in Cricket World Cup League 2Former New Zealand cricketer Tom Bruce has switched allegiance to Scotland and will debut in their ICC Men's Cricket World Cup League 2 series in Canada this month. Monica Seles reveals battle with myasthenia gravis, a neuromuscular diseaseMonica Seles has revealed she was diagnosed three years ago with myasthenia gravis, a chronic neuromuscular disease, and is speaking publicly for the first time to raise awareness ahead of the US Open.

Test cricket a hit: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy breaks digital viewership recordsThe England-India five-match Test series set a new digital viewership benchmark with over 170 million viewers. India leveled the series by winning a dramatic fifth Test on the final day at The Oval, London.

Watch: Rohit Sharma flaunts his stunning new Lamborghini on Mumbai roadsIndia's ODI captain Rohit Sharma was seen driving his brand new Lamborghini on the roads of Mumbai, making fans turn their heads.

National Sports Bill will end stagnation, bring in transparency: PT UshaIOA President and Rajya Sabha MP PT Usha on Tuesday backed the National Sports Governance Bill, calling it a step to end decades of "stagnant status quo" and bring "transparency and accountability" to Indian sports administration.

Dewald Brevis shatters India batter's record with 125: Stat PackAUS vs SA, 2nd T20I: Young batter Dewald Brevis smashed an unbeaten 125 off 56 balls to power South Africa to 218 for seven in the second T20I at the Marrara Cricket Ground in Darwin.

Isak should sack his agent: Former Liverpool manager amidst transfer sagaAlexander Isak's Newcastle exit saga heats up as Don Hutchison blasts the striker's agent, urges a transfer request, and Liverpool waits in the wings after a 110 million pounds bid rejection, keeping fans glued to the summer drama.

Delhi Capitals star replaces Sadia Iqbal as No.1 bowler in T20I rankingsAustralian all-rounder Annabel Sutherland became the No.1 ranked bowler in Women's T20Is, replacing Pakistan left-arm spinner Sadia Iqbal. Iqbal dropped two places in the rankings.

Shubman Gill pips Stokes to win historic 4th ICC Player of the Month awardIndia's Test captain Shubman Gill has been named ICC Men's Player of the Month for July 2025 after his prolific run in the recent Test series against England. Sophia Dunkley was adjudged Women's Player of the Month for her stellar show against India.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
